column4: Hi, I want to make two sessions, one with comiz and one "clean" with just xfce4
compiz that is
do you really need sessions for that? you could use fusion icon and toggle compiz on and off from the panel?
well, I guess you are right. How do ii make this fusion icon?
package is in the repos: "sudo apt-get install fusion-icon"
exactly. i use it under xfce to switch on/off compiz/emerald (although i am using compiz less and less, since xfwm now has compositing built in)
greate help! I ran the code in the terminal, now where is my icon? =) Do I have to reboot?
no, it should appear in system tray when ran . you will prob want it to start up by default i would think too
alright, I ran it from the panel menu, now it is displayed in my upper right corner. Will now click it ..
wow, there are alot of usefull settings in it! Switching was flawles, now on xfce4
Now, how do I make it enabled on startup?
in xfce: setting manager > autostarted apps
Ah of course =) what line of code would that be? Just: "fusion-icon"?
yup
Thanx alot for your help!
quite welcome enjoy!
One more thing; I want to ad compiz to the autostarted applications to, what line of code is that? "compiz --replace"?

yes (but make a note that if you are saving running application that you aren't autostarting applications that are saved - i ran into this and turned of saving running applications - something to keep in mind)
Greate tip! How do I turn "saving apps" off?
Settings Manager > Sessions and Startup  (that is a permanent change. the logout dialog has a checkbox so you can toggle it as you like each time if you want to test things out first)
Once again, thank you for your help! IÄºl get back to you if I have more questions for sure =)
